<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 278, 326, 294]]<|/det|>
## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 153, 314]]<|/det|>
Paper 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 278, 905, 333]]<|/det|>
0606/11 May/June 2017 2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 339, 415, 355]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 359, 435, 375]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Electronic calculator  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 388, 407]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 718, 432]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 432, 320, 446]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 504, 461]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 460, 504, 475]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 380, 490]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 282, 516]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 828, 545]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 593, 559]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 559, 603, 574]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 584, 606, 600]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 599, 759, 614]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 614, 437, 629]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 80.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 73, 599, 91]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 164, 561, 182]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 195, 240, 213]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 225, 383, 244]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^{2} + bx + c = 0\),  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[411, 243, 586, 280]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 301, 228, 319]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[243, 322, 754, 361]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n},\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 370, 494, 406]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 470, 594, 488]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 502, 156, 520]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[418, 530, 583, 600]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 630, 242, 648]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 653, 590, 686]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 705, 593, 725]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[438, 732, 558, 761]]<|/det|>
\[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 918, 94]]<|/det|>
The line \(y = kx - 5\), where \(k\) is a positive constant, is a tangent to the curve \(y = x^{2} + 4x\) at the point \(A\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 106, 143, 125]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 106, 356, 125]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 425, 143, 443]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 425, 920, 459]]<|/det|>
Find the gradient of the normal to the curve at the point \(A\), giving your answer in the form \(a + b\sqrt{5}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 440, 920, 459]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 97, 94]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 860, 94]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(\mathrm{p}(x) = x^{3} + ax^{2} + bx - 48\). When \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(x - 3\) the remainder is 6.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 88, 514, 109]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\mathrm{p}'(1) = 0\), find the value of \(a\) and of \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 440, 97, 460]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 439, 138, 460]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 437, 920, 463]]<|/det|>
Simplify \(\sqrt{x^{8}y^{10}} \div \sqrt[3]{x^{3}y^{- 6}}\), giving your answer in the form \(x^{a}y^{b}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers. [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 551, 144, 570]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 551, 175, 570]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 546, 922, 586]]<|/det|>
Show that \(4(t - 2)^{\frac{1}{2}} + 5(t - 2)^{\frac{3}{2}}\) can be written in the form \((t - 2)^{p}(qt + r)\), where \(p\), \(q\) and \(r\) are constants to be found.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 567, 920, 586]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 782, 180, 801]]<|/det|>

The diagram shows a figure \(OABC\), where \(\overrightarrow{OA} = \mathbf{a}\), \(\overrightarrow{OB} = \mathbf{b}\) and \(\overrightarrow{OC} = \mathbf{c}\). The lines \(AC\) and \(OB\) intersect at the point \(M\) where \(M\) is the midpoint of the line \(AC\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 101, 813, 121]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 374, 920, 408]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 319, 920, 370]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a circle, centre \(O\), radius \(12\mathrm{cm}\). The points \(A\) and \(B\) lie on the circumference of the circle and form a rectangle with the points \(C\) and \(D\). The length of \(AD\) is \(8\mathrm{cm}\) and the area of the minor sector \(AOB\) is \(150\mathrm{cm}^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 382, 143, 401]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 381, 667, 401]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 382, 920, 401]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 81, 920, 120]]<|/det|>

<mark>[8]

<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 74, 767, 96]]<|/det|>
On the axes below sketch the graphs of \(y = |2x - 5|\) and \(9y = 80x - 16x^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 580, 920, 599]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[106, 739, 141, 758]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 738, 635, 758]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 739, 920, 758]]<|/det|>

<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 472, 109]]<|/det|>
Show that \(5 + 4\tan^{2}\left(\frac{x}{3}\right) = 4\sec^{2}\left(\frac{x}{3}\right) + 1.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 82, 920, 102]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 204, 143, 223]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 198, 589, 233]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}x}\Big(\tan \Big(\frac{x}{3}\Big)\Big) = \frac{1}{3}\sec^2\Big(\frac{x}{3}\Big)\), find \(\int \sec^2\Big(\frac{x}{3}\Big)\mathrm{d}x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 207, 920, 227]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 562, 920, 603]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = 5 + 4\tan^{2}\left(\frac{x}{3}\right)\). Using the results from parts **(i)** and **(ii)**, find the exact area of the shaded region enclosed by the curve, the \(x\)-axis and the lines \(x = \frac{\pi}{2}\) and \(x = \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 616, 920, 635]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 910, 665, 930]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 82, 104, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 81, 138, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 76, 416, 107]]<|/det|>
Given that \(y = \frac{\mathrm{e}^{3x}}{4x^2 + 1}\), find \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 82, 918, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 272, 144, 289]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 260, 821, 299]]<|/det|>
Variables \(x, y\) and \(t\) are such that \(y = 4 \cos \left(x + \frac{\pi}{3}\right) + 2 \sqrt{3} \sin \left(x + \frac{\pi}{3}\right)\) and \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dt}} = 10\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 314, 183, 333]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 312, 468, 339]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 316, 920, 335]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 567, 180, 586]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 562, 468, 592]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\frac{\mathrm{dx}}{\mathrm{dt}}\) when \(x = \frac{\pi}{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 567, 920, 586]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]
